citation.article-title: Corynebacterium thomssenii sp. nov., a Corynebacterium with N-acetyl-beta-glucosaminidase activity from human clinical specimens

p.s: Description of Corynebacterium thomssenii sp. nov.
Corynebacterium thomssenii (thomsse'.ni.i. M . L. gen. n. thomssenii of Thomssen, to honour Reiner Thomssen, a prominent German virologist and medical microbiologist)
The description of biochemical and morphological characteristics is based on the results of the studies of one strain.
Cells are Gram-positive, non-motile, nonspore-forming diphtheroids.
Colonies of this fastidious slow-growing bacterium are whitish, circular, mucoid and sticky.
After 24 h incubation on Columbia agar supplemented with 5% sheep blood, the colony diameter is less than 0.5 mm.
Metabolism is fermentative.
Catalase is positive.

Acid is produced from glucose, maltose, sucrose, D-fructose, D-mannose, trehalose and 5-keto-gluconate, but not from mannitol, xylose, glycerol, erythritol, arabinose, adonitol, β-methyl-xyloside, L-sorbose, rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, sorbitol, α-methyl-D-mannoside, α-methyl-D-glucoside, N-acetyl-glucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, salicin, cellobiose, melibiose, inulin, melezitose, D-raffinose, glycogen, xylitol, β-gentiobiose, D-lyxose, L-arabitol, gluconate and 2-keto-gluconate.
Urea is hydrolysed.
Nitrate is not reduced.
Aesculin hydrolysis is negative.
The strain is non-lipophilic, the CAMP reaction is negative.
DNase activity is observed Tyrosine is not hydrolysed.

Activities of pyrazinamidase, alkaline phosphatase, esterase, esterase lipase leucine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, acid phosphatase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase are present, whereas lipase, valine arylamidase, chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase are not detected.
The cell wall contains arabinose and galactose.
meso-Diaminopimelic acid is the cell wall diamino acid.
Short-chain mycolic acids (C32-C36) represent.
The main straight-chain saturated fatty acids are palmitic and stearic acids, the predominant unsaturated fatty acid is oleic acid.
The polar lipids are composed of diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylinositol and phosphatidylinositol mannosides.
MK-8(H2) and MK-9(H2) are the predominant menaquinones and small amounts of MK-10(H2) are also found.
Isolated from human clinical specimens with as-yet-unknown pathogenicity.
Type strain DSM44276 has been deposited in the German Collection of Microorganisms and Cell Cultures (DSMZ), Braunschweig, Germany.
